The time has come! At last a designer advert that isn't boring! But why?

Well because at BoxSmart, we are a team of interesting people that aren't boring in the tech world! We are ENERGY.

and more things you can offer!

We built Boxsmart to help talented people launch their brands and leave the filthy rat race that London has made these days. So you can get an idea of the type of people that run this ship – GIVERS.

2- Someone that is simply fed up of the rat race. That is ‘boxed’ (excuse the pun) in a fixed role and can’t dip their finger in certain areas. Probably someone that wants you good enough to exploit but not good enough for you to leave right? We don’t need someone imprisoned at a desk. We are over that. In fact we all work from home, coffee shops and have board meetings over dinners at nice restaurants! Why not? We are clever and we work in a remote generation.

A – To support the Ceo/Marketing team in rebuiding the website and making the other sites to come

And that’s it! Just someone that wants to team up!

So it's someone looking for the LONG BALL as well as a decent amount in the short term. We want a member of the TEAM


We will teach you all aspects of business. You are on the pulse with the CEO and the privilege to work with a a great team!


So it’s not just a job! It’s a JOURNEY!



Have a think,.. We need the right person… the rest will fall into place.

items.title: Self-Managing Systems Designer & Facilitator
items.content:
Self-Managing Systems Designer & Facilitator at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Change Management, Building Coalitions, Organizational Development
Compensation
$135K–$145K
0.001%–0.001%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we've built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh: a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal.  Our mission is to use these decentralized solutions to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

About Organizational Development at ConsenSys

Consensys is developing itself as a self organizing system. ConsenSys believes that this is the only way we can be nimble and innovative enough to stay in the lead of the blockchain field. Project DNA combines our Organizational Development & Global Operations Circles. Our goal is to facilitate the development of a self-organizing ecosystem that is agile, scalable, representative and transparent. We coordinate the creation of the mindsets, structures and skillsets needed for self-organization at the individual, team, and company-wide level.

About the role

The Self-Management Facilitator/Systems Designer will be a key facilitator, thought leader and brand builder in improving our ability to scale and move towards a decentralized operating system. You will be instrumental in establishing the brand of the Organizational Development circle as a thought leader in decentralized systems of self-management. You will play an integral role as facilitator and coach to our people in their self-management journey. You will be a critical driver to our ability to scale and move towards a decentralized operating system.

The Organizational Development team is working to build out the operating system, training and skills building capability and education systems needed to build a decentralized, self-managed organization.  Because we are creating a self organizing system, this role requires facilitative leadership -- the ability to develop common vision among teams. Even though the role needs is senior level experience, it also requires the ability to follow the leadership from other team members. That element of culture fit is an essential aspect of this role.

Responsibilities

Work with the Organizational Development circle to identify high impact areas for change at the individual, team and system levels
Build hypotheses around these areas of change, design,develop and execute these experiments
Work with Organizational Development to facilitate the process of building self-organizing systems, practices, and mindsets at ConsenSys with teams, individuals and the company as a whole
Help build a diverse team to deliver and measure these experiments
Set up key metrics and feedback loops to be able to adapt the process as necessary
Build our brand through communication of learnings and case studies throughout the organization

Requirements

You have built effective systems of self-management in organizations or communities
Proven experience through case studies of building coalitions that have successfully reached their change goals
You care about doing high-leverage, impactful work in the world
Creating a system of organizing humans built foundationally in trust keeps you up at night or gets you up in the morning
Passionate about and have experience in building the “future of work”, e.g. Teal organizations, self-management, movement building
You are user-centered in your approach on everything
You take an Agile, experimental approach in problem-solving
Can communicate with stakeholders across many different businesses and international teams
Can build multicultural teams that are highly effective
Highly facilitative
Creative and innovative problem-solver
Able to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with teammates, community members, vendors, and partners
Comfortable with ambiguity, yet driven to create order out of chaos
Systems thinker, with ability to understand key business drivers that contribute to operational and financial success.
Demonstrated desire and drive to be a recognized thought leader within the larger Self-Management or Movement-Building community. An established network and positive brand are a plus.
Comfortable with working in a remote-first environment
Up to 30% travel

Experience with startups, or working at a non-traditional corporate organization or nonprofit is preferred.  Knowledge about blockchain & Ethereum is not required, but candidates should be interested in the technologies poised to transform the way we live, and be open to learning deeply about blockchain topics.

User Researcher & Experience Designer
Based Central London
Permanent, Full Time

Mindwave Ventures are rethinking, reshaping and redesigning how technology is used to create impact at scale within healthcare.

The team are seeking a UX designer with a strong background in user research to join the team full time. You will work closely with designers, users and clients to facilitate conversations and ensure the products we create are useful, usable and valuable.

Projects you will work across may include, but are not limited to:

• A clinical assessment app for developing countries
• A personal health record platform for mental health services
• A software platform that facilitates discussions in hospital appointments
• A goal-setting app for employment services

Your responsibilities:

You will work alongside our Lead Designer and collaborate with the team on all activities below.
• Conduct user research (in-depth interviews, designing surveys, collating and presenting results)
• Facilitate discovery, design and strategy workshops
• Write reports to consolidate the outputs, findings and recommendations
• Synthesise insights and identify user needs
• Translate user needs into user stories for development
• Map out user journeys and service blueprints
• Create clickable prototypes for user testing
• Engage with clients, presenting work to date and insights
• Design and create presentations, reports, style guides and assets


Skills and experience – must haves:

• Confidence and experience facilitating conversations and workshops
• Experience designing and conducting face to face and remote user testing
• An interest in data and evidence and how to use it to improve products and processes
• Experience using Adobe Creative tools such as InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop and Sketch
• Experience of creating interactive experiences for apps (mobile & tablet) and web (mobile, tablet and desktop)
• Solid understanding of UX principles
• Incredible attention to detail
• On top of the latest digital trends and standards, including accessibility principles
• Able to work remotely as an individual as well as in a team setting


Desirable

• Have worked in an Agile environment
• Experience across multiple user testing tools and platforms
• Have used a wide variety of user research and testing methods - e.g. in-depth interviews, surveys, workshops, remote testing, analysis
• Data visualisation experience is a bonus, but not a must


About us

Mindwave Ventures are making an impact in the world of health and wellbeing by creating products and services that truly meet the needs of our users.

We value testing and learning above all else, using good design and evidence to drive our projects forward.

We’re an incredibly passionate and energetic team consisting of designers, researchers, project managers and developers. We work closely with clinicians and other third parties to ensure we are utilising the best brains in the biz – across a multitude of sectors.

If you want to come and make a big change in a small place, we’d love to hear from you.

To apply, please send us:

• CV - showing your key skills, interests and personality
• Short cover letter - why is working at Mindwave right for you?
• Portfolio of UX and UI – showcasing a select number of projects that show your work in the field.

items.title: Help Scout: Senior Product Designer
items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Posted May 11

Help Scout
Headquarters: remote
www.helpscout.com/careers
View all Help Scout jobs →

Hello, there.

We’re Help Scout. A company you’ve maybe heard of before, or maybe not, but either way you’ve landed on this page because you were at least a little curious, and we like that about you. We spend our time making it easier for SMBs to talk with their customers. Today Help Scout is used by more than 8,000 businesses in 140 countries.

We’re looking for someone who’s really smart, and humble, and thorough, and meticulous, and self-motivated, and kind, and a little funny, and tenacious, and did I say self-motivated? Well, that’s because we’re a remote company! Being remote is fantastic, it’s empowering, and it’s perfect for people who like to be their own boss and push themselves to be at their very best every day.

That’s where you come in. As a Product Designer at Help Scout, you’ll spend your days creating tools that our customers use to deliver a great experience. Smiles on faces — if that’s your jam, we’d love to meet you.

About the role:

  • You’ll be the sixth member of the Help Scout design team. We work remotely from places like New York, Sydney, Ireland and Nashville. You can work from wherever you please as long as you have 4+ hours of overlap with EDT (US East Coast).
  • We’ll ask you to own the entire design process. For a new project, you’ll be given a brief and will partner with Product to do User/Customer research. You’ll be doing the wireframes, prototyping, visual design, interaction design, and will partner with engineers to get the implementation juuuuuust right.
  • You’ll be embedded on a couple cross-functional teams with one product lead, one QA, and 2-5 engineers depending on the project. You’ll work hand-in-hand with your teammates to ship your best work to our customers.
  • Although each designer is embedded on different teams, it’s important that everyone makes each other better. Over Slack, video chats, and design docs, you’ll provide guidance and critical feedback on other work outside of your purview. You’ll also get that sort of support from your teammates on your projects.
  • You will have the freedom to pioneer your own discovery phase and find ways to improve our product. You’ll find that we’re passionate about putting in the work to constantly improve on the things we’ve made.
  • The role says “Senior” but we do not delineate between junior and senior designers on the team. We’re looking for senior-level skill and experience in every role at Help Scout, partially because it works better in a remote culture.

About you:

  • Your passion is to work on large-scale software a lot of people use, but to be given ownership of the project from concept to completion. The design challenges are complex, and the work has a bunch of constraints. Despite the difficulty, this is the work you love most.
  • We all love a good pattern library and pixel-perfect design, but you prefer to get involved in a project way before then. For you, it starts with sketches, wireframes and a keen understanding of the problem from all angles.
  • You’re very thorough and detail-oriented. You don’t get tired of solving a problem and iterating on the solution, even after a few months of working towards the best experience.
  • You’re humble, yet opinionated about what makes a great product experience. You leverage your skills and expertise to help others and make the people around you better at their craft.
  • You have more than a few years of design experience, and you’ve grown so much that you cringe when you look back at your early work.
  • You can simplify complex problems and clearly articulate your thought process to others in writing. This is especially important in a remote culture like ours.
  • You collaborate well and communicate early and often. You explain your work by extrapolating on everything from your inklings and curiosities, to the rationale behind final your decisions.
  • You actively seek critical feedback. As a matter of fact, you can’t get enough of it, because you know that your work only gets better when your team puts their eyes on it.
  • You have strong taste, and your eye for visual design is as strong as your ability to dream up exceptional customer experiences.
  • You prefer to collaborate directly with developers and product stakeholders, carefully considering the tension between business and customer needs.
  • When it comes to understanding a problem, you have no hesitation in setting up customer interviews, doing usability testing, or conducting a survey.
  • This isn’t an absolute requirement, but strong HTML and CSS skills will likely make you a more successful product designer at Help Scout. If you can write JavaScript, it’s all the better, but we won’t ask you to write production code.

Who you'll work with

  • Linda Eliasen, Design Team Lead - You’ll be reporting to Linda. She’s been a designer like you, for companies like Mailchimp, Dropbox and Squarespace.
  • Design team -Sean,Jared(co-founder),BuzzandTonycan’t wait to meet you!

The kind of work we do
BriteCore is essentially a CMS for insurance companies. They use it to manage all aspects of their business, including tracking policies, managing contacts and handling claims.

This means our users typically see our app more as a business tool like Microsoft Word or Google Sheets than a website (even though it is completely a web-based app). They also are using BriteCore for several hours every day, and are concerned with doing things quickly and efficiently. This, along with the complicated nature of insurance, means we deal with some complex workflows, and try to set ourselves apart from our competitors with a smooth UX that helps them navigate these tough processes.

  • Ask in-depth questions to understand a process, and back up decisions with research and user tests
  • Iterate on designs using a variety of techniques, such as sketches, workflow diagrams and high-fidelity mockups

BriteCore is a remote-first company — even employees who live in our home city of Springfield, MO usually work from home! And most of the people you will work with are scattered across the US and the globe. This means that remote team members are just as much part of the company as local employees. NewCity, a digital agency in Blacksburg, Virginia, is looking for a Senior Designer to join our team. You will work daily with our design and development staff, as well as our clients, to bring new ideas to life.

The Company

NewCity is a 23-year-old, 25-person firm, working in a highly collaborative, low-ego environment to create digital experiences for the real world. We ask big questions, dream big dreams, but at the end of the day we build things that work. Our culture is can-do, roll-up-your-sleeves, I’ve got your back and you’ve got mine. We’re constantly learning, experimenting and reinventing NewCity.

We’re organized around seven key disciplines: user experience, visual design, content strategy, front-end and back-end development, digital marketing and analytics, project management and business development. Our project teams are made of people from each discipline.

The Job

As a Senior Designer at NewCity, you will

  • inspire clients as you explore how their brand will shine in digital, occasionally developing new brand identities in the process.
  • take ownership of the design process from concept and design to presentation and delivery, working directly with clients and on 2 to 4 project teams at a time.
  • manage and mentor junior designers.
  • play an integral role in moving NewCity's creative approach forward.
  • periodically participate in sales pitches to prospective clients.
  • travel occasionally to work on-site directly with clients, usually not longer than 2-3 days at a time.

This is s full-time position. Preference will be given to applicants available to work at our office in Blacksburg, Virginia. We are open to considering full-time remote for candidates with successful experience as a remote team member and the references to prove it.

We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package.

You

  • You have 5+ years experience creating gorgeous, brand-driven, human-centered design for responsive web and mobile and an online portfolio that reflects your awesomeness.
  • You are proactive by nature and possess strong communication, collaboration, research, problem-solving and presentation skills.
  • You present design ideas clearly and effectively with insightful rationale.
  • You’ve got a solid understanding of how production and programming requirements affect your design. Knowing the opportunities and constraints of CSS, HTML and CMS platforms is fundamental in creating successful design solutions for our clients. Knowing how to collaboratively communicate your vision to developers is key to ensuring the quality of the final product.

Roughly half our work each year is with repeat clients.

Our clients say there’s nothing cookie-cutter in our portfolio. They say we capture the unique DNA of their brand. That’s huge for us. You’ll be instrumental in helping us continue to do that.

Role: Designer, Heist Studios

Location: Clerkenwell, London

Our vision

At Heist, we believe underwear can be an instrument of progress. While many industries understand our era’s desire for autonomy, choice and freedom, women’s underwear has lagged behind. Effectively, all women are living in underwear inadequate to their time.

We believe that radical innovation in underwear design can ensure that every woman, every day, is living in underwear that allows her to progress in the way that she demands in every other area of her life. That’s why our designs are built on an understanding of how bodies move, not just how they look.

This approach led us to reimagine the most mundane wardrobe staple, a pair of tights, into a product that redefines superiority in comfort and fit for every female body. We’re now using polymer physics, computational engineering models and 3D knitwear to reinvent shapewear. Next, we’ll be taking our design ethos to make a bra that actually fits. (Finally!)

Our journey

We may be only two years old, but it’s already been quite a ride. Our first range reinvented the humble pair of tights, delivering 30% month-on-month growth and propelling us into the pages of almost every major European publication. We’re backed by some of the biggest investors in fashion and technology, and on a busy day, we can sell a pair of tights every 15 seconds. Even our tube adverts caused a scandal. Most importantly, we have tens of thousands of customers who genuinely love Heist and the products we develop and ship around the world. We are continually growing and creating a creative brand that not just looks good, but also tell a story.
Your responsibilities

As Designer, you will work on a range of tasks from designing emails and banners to advertising, across both print and digital. You will be working within our Creative team, supporting them on day to day tasks as we continue to grow.

Being more specific, you will:

• Design work for new banner ads, print and web material.
• Be able to constantly think of new designs to push Heist forward.

You

We are a diverse bunch of people at Heist. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:
• You deeply care about Heist’s mission; you have a desire to build something iconic, that will disrupt an industry, and women’s lives.
• You thrive on challenge and change; you naturally gravitate to the hardest questions first and love thinking differently to solve them.
• You are biased towards action and you’re happiest when you’re ‘getting stuff done’.
• You’re open, positive & straightforward. You’re not afraid to stand up for your convictions, even when it’s hard to do so.

Hi, we’re GMB, and we teach people how to use their bodies better. 

The word “fitness” has been perverted to mean doing things you hate to impress people you don’t like with a body that’s too tired and sore to do anything fun. We’re here to change that, and we need your help.


We started out in 2010 with an email subscription form, a YouTube account, and a lot of scrambling to figure things out. Even with over 40,000 clients in 80 countries, pretty much everything about how we’ve built our company and marketed our products has been bootstrapped by a small group of deeply invested people wearing a lot of hats and learning as we went along. Even with a team of over twenty people, that’s our DNA – learning and making it work.

This year, we’re making big changes to our product and we are looking for a UX / UI Designer to join GMB. You’ll be part of a team that is helping to imagine and build new products — as well as improve existing ones.

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Design and take ownership for the user experience of our products — including creating user journeys, wireframes and interactive prototypes
  • Create high fidelity user interaction and interface designs
  • Work closely with our engineering team to ensure implementation aligns with designs
  • Develop standards and a unified style guide for your designs, to ensure a consistent user experience and to make it easy for others to implement
  • Present and communicate your ideas and designs to others in the company
  • Contribute to overall brand and design strategy
  • Be involved in various kinds of usability testing (User testing, Beta testing, A/B etc.)

To do this job, you will need:

  • Proven experience as a UX / UI Designer — backed up by a strong portfolio
  • Experience in designing high quality experiences for both mobile and desktop
  • Experience in user journey mapping, wire-framing and interactive prototypes
  • High attention to detail and a passion for keeping designs simple and efficient
  • Well rounded design skills that range from early wire frames, through to high fidelity designs

Other Requirements & Competencies

  • Know how to follow instructions and how to be creative – and how to choose between them.
  • Speak and read/write perfect English.
  • Have a sense of humor.
  • Always work to develop a growth mindset.
  • Good at self-managing.
  • A ‘Hands On’ attitude: You are naturally curious and want to understand how things work. You also aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty and take ownership when issues arise
  • Able to work in an agile environment. This means working iteratively and a willingness to change priorities based on changing business dynamics
  • Can make things happen. You are a doer/maker as well as a planner.
  • Can manage written communication with a lot of different people.

Not mandatory, but nice to have:

  • You’ve used one of our products
  • Worked within a distributed team environment
  • Experience with designing WordPress themes

Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience, but you can get a pretty good sense of our benefits and such here.

What’s it like working at GMB?

GMB is a kick-ass company.

GMB is about creating autonomy. We’re working to make the world a better place by teaching people to take control of what their bodies can do so they can contribute to their families and communities. We create options for exploration and self-expression.


And we work the way we practice. Like our idea of fitness and the way we deliver our programs, very little about the way we work is like what you’d find in a traditional company. Here’s how we exemplify autonomy at work:

Some of the things we value and encourage are: continuous learning, travel & facetime, as well as time off. Learn more about all our benefits here.

items.content:
Design Facilitator at ConsenSys

Europe, Greater London, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Design Thinking, Design Facillitation, Workshop Design and Facilitation

$90K–$120K
No Equity

Job Description

ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we've built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh: a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. Our mission is to use these decentralized solutions to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.


About the role:

As a Design Facilitator you will work collaboratively, creatively, and flexibly with interdisciplinary teams and with our clients. The Design Facilitation practice at ConsenSys is primarily driven by our desire to help our teams and customers use Design Thinking to achieve outstanding, human-centered results. The Design Thinking team at ConsenSys currently consists of two facilitators and is projected to grow to four by July 2018. Future growth will depend on demand for Design Thinking from the wider organisation.

What gets us excited:

-You have a proven history of using design thinking in a variety of ways and in a variety of locations and cultures, at lots of different places from big to small companies, and start-ups.
-A strong point of view - you aren’t just along for the ride. Lots of blog posts and videos and podcasts (for example) where we can learn about what you care about and how you express yourself.
-Background in teaching and making your own courses and curriculum.
-References who will say lots of nice things about you and help us understand how you would fit in at ConsenSys.
-A passion for exploring the possibilities of blockchain technology.

Responsibilities:

-Run workshops in all forms — a facilitator needs to have a comprehensive grasp of design thinking at a sophisticated level, including methods and mindsets. You need to be able to effectively guide a team of people through the design thinking framework in person and remotely. Please note that we are not looking for theoretical trainers - you must be experienced at delivering hands-on facilitation services.
-Advocate, inspire, reflect—we’re going to be building the airplane as we fly it. The facilitator also needs to be a content creator and think about how to better apply design thinking in the venture accelerator model.
-Client facing — for ConsenSys to succeed, we will need to interact with potential customers and users in order to understand their worlds, needs, and aspirations. The facilitator needs to be comfortable working with people outside the organization. Typical client sessions will be for consulting engagements and for helping teams co-create with their users.
-Teaching and modeling — helping teams get better at design thinking so they can apply it on their own in-between facilitator-led workshops.
-Stay on your feet—a facilitator is always actively adapting to the environment they’re shaping. You need to know when to be flexible, when to hold firm, and how to calmly navigate ever-changing waters.
-Staying organized—tracking who is asking for workshops, when you are running workshops, when you are traveling, finding supplies, planes, and hotels. Being an independent facilitator has a lot of moving pieces and you’ll most be on your own to handle your schedule.

Requirements:

-You understand human-centered design philosophy and love sharing design methodologies.
-You really care about how process turns innovative ideas into awesome realities.
-You love to learn. Blockchain, design thinking, and software development are all young enough disciplines that there is an endless amount to discover and invent.
-Test and learn is part of your DNA.
-You restlessly reinvent yourself and your facilitation practice.
-You question everything! You regularly ask yourself “Why does it have to be this way and how can it be better?”
-Self starter— you won’t have a manager in this role. No one will tell you what you have to do, and you work better that way.

Some perspectives on facilitation to check out:

https://medium.com/design-ibm/build-experiences-not-features-9ae0d2c0117a

https://medium.com/design-ibm/prototyping-ibm-design-thinking-method-cards-1328080da382

https://medium.com/design-ibm/facilitator-unconference-2017-with-design-at-business-d20696ab6354

Application instructions:

Cover letters and resumes are not required. Instead, please send us your LinkedIn profile, website or other places where you express your creativity (writing, photography, podcasts, etc).

BriteCore is essentially a CMS for insurance companies. They use it to manage all aspects of their business, including tracking policies, managing contacts and handling claims.

This means our users typically see our app more as a business tool like Microsoft Word or Google Sheets than a website (even though it is completely a web-based app). They also are using BriteCore for several hours every day, and are concerned with doing things quickly and efficiently. This, along with the complicated nature of insurance, means we deal with some complex workflows, and try to set ourselves apart from our competitors with a smooth UX that helps them navigate these tough processes.

What you might be doing

We’re looking for a team member who thinks critically about user experience, and is able to see it through with a polished interface. This means you might do things like:

- Create an aesthetically pleasing, on brand UI for a new or existing component in our design system.

- Ask in-depth questions to understand a process, and back up decisions with research and user tests.

- Iterate on designs using a variety of techniques, such as sketches, workflow diagrams and high-fidelity mockups

BriteCore is a remote-first company — even employees who live in our home city of Springfield, MO usually work from home! And most of the people you will work with are scattered across the US and the globe. This means that remote team members are just as much part of the company as local employees. items.content:
Full-time

(Springfield, MO (Remote Work Encouraged))

We are hiring for a mid-level UI/UX designer who is able to help us take complex workflows and distill them into a thoughtful experience for people using our app.

 

This position is on our growing design team, which works closely with our development teams as part of an iterative design process. You would have an important role in helping us redesign key parts of our app UI, and would also be part of an overall effort to create and standardize our design system.

 

The kind of work we do

BriteCore is essentially a CMS for insurance companies. They use it to manage all aspects of their business, including tracking policies, managing contacts and handling claims.

 

This means our users typically see our app more as a business tool like Microsoft Word or Google Sheets than a website (even though it is completely a web-based app). They also are using BriteCore for several hours every day, and are concerned with doing things quickly and efficiently. This, along with the complicated nature of insurance, means we deal with some complex workflows, and try to set ourselves apart from our competitors with a smooth UX that helps them navigate these tough processes.

 

What you might be doing

We’re looking for a team member who thinks critically about user experience, and is able to see it through with a polished interface. This means you might do things like:

- Create an aesthetically pleasing, on brand UI for a new or existing component in our design system.

- Ask in-depth questions to understand a process, and back up decisions with research and user tests.

- Iterate on designs using a variety of techniques, such as sketches, workflow diagrams and high-fidelity mockups

 

What it is like to work here

BriteCore is a remote-first company — even employees who live in our home city of Springfield, MO usually work from home! And most of the people you will work with are scattered across the US and the globe. This means that remote team members are just as much part of the company as local employees. We also allow a lot of flexibility in terms of time off. In return, we expect all of our employees to be productive and accountable, which means you'll work alongside a great, dedicated team.

Responsibilities

  • Create effective and beautiful interfaces that solve our user's problems

  • Iterate and improve on existing parts of the app

  • Inform design decisions with data, user testing

  • Communicate clearly

  • Welcome feedback and collaboration

  • Be friendly, confident, and patient with others

More about the company

 

At BriteCore, we build gorgeous, scalable, and usable cloud-based insurance software. This is a company where design is deeply valued and has a seat at the table. We have created a team of top performers developing modern systems for the insurance industry. Our team enjoys working together, and takes tremendous pride and ownership in our platform. The environment is progressive – we are building a modular design system for use across all of our products. We love great technology and design and it shows in every aspect of our product. Our team enjoys a flexible, balanced, and stimulating environment. We promote a high quality of life for our employees by allowing them to choose their own schedule and location. MailerLite is a team of 32 designers, developers, writers, runners, photographers, surfers, chess players, foodies, parents, dreamers, travellers and genuinely nice people. We all share one goal - to build the best email marketing software and help our customers grow their business.

At MailerLite we believe in keeping things simple. No corporate structure, no unnecessary meetings. We have a flat organisation with a team of driven and motivated people. Everyone in our team can pitch his idea for a new feature or a change and lead the project.
We strive to build company culture where work, socialising and personal development go hand in hand. Our culture is defined by 10 company values.

Job description

You will be responsible for developing online video content strategy, creating videos from start to finish, coordinating and collaborating with internal and external content creators.
You should have a strong understanding of the latest online video trends and are able to translate stories into video content. The content should be relevant, discoverable, and crafted with our audience in mind. You will manage and grow video content distribution and monitor web traffic & video-specific metrics to identify best practices.
You can work from our Vilnius office or be remote. We use Slack, Trello and 15five to be connected.

Requirements

  • Experience in creating original videos.
  • Experience in YouTube and Social media marketing with video.
  • Ability to appear on camera.
  • Comfortable directing others on camera and conducting on-camera interviews.
  • Deep understanding of all aspects of production - shooting, editing, lighting, audio, art directing, styling, and set decorating.
  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.
  • Prefered experience in email marketing and working with SaaS.
  • Self-starter with high level of initiative.
  • This position is full time (40 hours per week).

Special requirements for remote workers

  • You must have high speed Internet.
  • You must be able to travel to Vilnius, Lithuania and other places (at our expense) for team building gatherings that we call Workation.
  • You must be online throughout your work day, using Slack for communication with the team.
